meanings.definition: To plan more effectively than someone else.
meanings.sent1: She outplanned her friend by organizing the project efficiently.
meanings.sent2: He always outplans his competitors by thinking ahead.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel outplanned the birds by hiding extra nuts in its secret stash.
meanings.sent4: The detective outplanned the criminal, anticipating every move.
meanings.sent5: The coach outplanned the opposing team with a clever strategy.

meanings.definition: To have planned better than someone else.
meanings.sent1: They outplanned the other group by creating a detailed schedule.
meanings.sent2: The experienced team outplanned the newcomers effortlessly.
meanings.sent3: The student outplanned the teacher by finishing the assignment early.
meanings.sent4: The architect outplanned the competition with a groundbreaking design.
meanings.sent5: The explorer outplanned the expedition, ensuring a successful journey.
